content: That must have been a disappointing experience, but keep in mind that the person at the bank is a salesman. His job is to get people to apply. He is going to say you’ve made the right choice unless he thinks he can sell you something more expensive instead. Also, credit scores can be overhyped. The amount someone will lend you is limited by your income, and a great score won’t convince a bank to give you loans you couldn’t pay off.
